Sentencas: A critical factor for improving the long-term stability/reliability of solid oxide cell stacks is ensuring good adhesion between the stack components.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack

Sentencas: Specifically, ensuring strong adherence between the oxygen electrode and the interconnect is challenging.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack

Sentencas: This work compares the suitability of several materials as contact layers between a La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta-Ce0.8Gd0.2O2 composite oxygen electrode and Mn1.5Co1.5O4- or Co-coated metallic interconnects.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack

Sentencas: The contact materials were screened on the basis of measurements of the interface fracture energy using four-point bending of sandwiched samples.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack

Sentencas: The highest fracture energies were measured using a CuMn metallic, spinel-forming foam as the contact layer.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack

Sentencas: The fracture energy of the interface between a Mn1.5Co1.5O4-coated interconnect and the contact layer is similar to 8 times higher using the CuMn foam compared with using conventional (La0.8Sr0.2)(0.98)MnO3-sigma, La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta, (La0.8Sr0.2)(0.98)MnO3-sigma + La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta or LaNi0.6Fe0.4O3 as the contact material.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack

Sentencas: The interface bonding and fracture mechanisms are discussed on the basis of scanning electron microscopy investigations.
Titulo: Interface Fracture Energy of Contact Layers in a Solid Oxide Cell Stack
